intro: Saurauia humboldtiana var. bonplandii, commonly known as the Humboldt's saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
